subject: Fix the way q-agent-cleanup executes shell processes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-16 10:04:04.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/q-agent-cleanup.py'], 'message': 'Fix the way q-agent-cleanup executes shell processes

Shell commands are executed via subprocess.Popen(). Currently the
status of process is tracked by wait() method which results in deadlocks
when output is large enough (tens of kB). The correct way is to use
communicate() method.

Partial-bug 1436414

Change-Id: Ibbbfa3a5331f865e48160c37e9ba558af19dc680
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the way q-agent-cleanup executes shell processes

Shell commands are executed via subprocess.Popen(). Currently the
status of process is tracked by wait() method which results in deadlocks
when output is large enough (tens of kB). The correct way is to use
communicate() method.

Partial-bug 1436414

Change-Id: Ibbbfa3a5331f865e48160c37e9ba558af19dc680

subject: Remove openrc/admin-token usage in q-agent-cleanup.py
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-16 10:04:04.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/cluster/files/test_q_agent_cleanup.py', 'deployment/puppet/cluster/files/q-agent-cleanup.py'], 'message': 'Remove openrc/admin-token usage in q-agent-cleanup.py

Removes the openrc/admin-token deps in q-agent-cleanup.py. Instead it will
read the neutron service credentials out of neutron.conf. This has the
advantage that it must be up to date for neutron to function so if the
credential is modified it will have to be updated by the administrator.

Related-bug: #1347542
Closes-bug: #1396594

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/cluster/files/q-agent-cleanup.py
	utils/jenkins/python-test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Iee0968a079deacef24b56f34e9314b0ebecad0ae
'}]
commit_message:
Remove openrc/admin-token usage in q-agent-cleanup.py

Removes the openrc/admin-token deps in q-agent-cleanup.py. Instead it will
read the neutron service credentials out of neutron.conf. This has the
advantage that it must be up to date for neutron to function so if the
credential is modified it will have to be updated by the administrator.

Related-bug: #1347542
Closes-bug: #1396594

Conflicts:
	deployment/puppet/cluster/files/q-agent-cleanup.py
	utils/jenkins/python-test-requirements.txt

Change-Id: Iee0968a079deacef24b56f34e9314b0ebecad0ae

commit_message:
Backport packaging of OCF scripts from 6.1 to 6.0-updates

We need a way to deliver fixes for OCF scripts in MOS 6.0 deployments as a part of maintenance updates.
To achieve that OCF scripts should be packaged in the same way as they are in 6.1.

Change-Id: I511a23b8a8523a811cd2d2b6a418977ae9e979ba
Closes-bug: #1465771

subject: Add optional machine conversion into a pydot graph
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-06-18 17:44:55.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/api.rst', 'automaton/converters/__init__.py', 'automaton/converters/pydot.py'], 'message': 'Add optional machine conversion into a pydot graph

Both ironic and taskflow share this same code to convert
their state machines into a pydot graph which then gets
converted into SVG to form:

- http://docs.openstack.org/developer/taskflow/states.html
- http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/dev/states.html

So instead of duplicating it, provide a useful helper function
that both (and others) can share to produce a dot/graphviz pretty
diagram from a state machine.

Change-Id: I218740910163a1ca2587d706edc55852af1c0c74
'}]
commit_message:
Add optional machine conversion into a pydot graph

Both ironic and taskflow share this same code to convert
their state machines into a pydot graph which then gets
converted into SVG to form:

- http://docs.openstack.org/developer/taskflow/states.html
- http://docs.openstack.org/developer/ironic/dev/states.html

So instead of duplicating it, provide a useful helper function
that both (and others) can share to produce a dot/graphviz pretty
diagram from a state machine.

Change-Id: I218740910163a1ca2587d706edc55852af1c0c74

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-06-24 14:48:57.000000000', 'files': ['tools/min-env.sh', 'docs/minimal-environment-vars.md'], 'message': 'Auto generate minimal environment variables doc

This script will generate the minimal-environment-variables doc
based on the what each services has in the check_required_var field.
Anytime that field is changed run this script and commit the changes.
Since Neutron is a thick container, the script will get a few duplicates
in the neutron-agents field.  When Neutron is thinned out, this script
will function normally.

Closes-bug: #1459347

Co-Authored-By: Lon Hohberger <lhh@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1ba6bd5148af12cacfd872591b3c7b84a8dccba2
'}]
commit_message:
Auto generate minimal environment variables doc

This script will generate the minimal-environment-variables doc
based on the what each services has in the check_required_var field.
Anytime that field is changed run this script and commit the changes.
Since Neutron is a thick container, the script will get a few duplicates
in the neutron-agents field.  When Neutron is thinned out, this script
will function normally.

Closes-bug: #1459347

Co-Authored-By: Lon Hohberger <lhh@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I1ba6bd5148af12cacfd872591b3c7b84a8dccba2

subject: Add Heat resource support
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-06-23 03:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/tests/unit/orchestration/v1/test_proxy.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/orchestration/v1/test_resource.py', 'openstack/orchestration/v1/_proxy.py', 'openstack/orchestration/v1/resource.py'], 'message': 'Add Heat resource support

This patch adds support to listing resources from a Heat stack. To the
make the test case happy, test_proxy_base is slightly modified. Also,
when testing proxy methods, some mock calls (decorators) are introduced.

The functional test in previous patchsets is pulled out and left as a
TODO item. Will need to fix some related resource.find() logic before
making functional tests work.

Change-Id: Ibc553b0927e019cd03dc49ec16b5e41e4526bde3
'}]
commit_message:
Add Heat resource support

This patch adds support to listing resources from a Heat stack. To the
make the test case happy, test_proxy_base is slightly modified. Also,
when testing proxy methods, some mock calls (decorators) are introduced.

The functional test in previous patchsets is pulled out and left as a
TODO item. Will need to fix some related resource.find() logic before
making functional tests work.

Change-Id: Ibc553b0927e019cd03dc49ec16b5e41e4526bde3

commit_message:
Change fat neutron container into thin containers

Key difference here is the ip_wrapper.py file. This file and docker 1.7
allow for the network namespaces to be created in the host mount
namespace and propogated into the containers.

Co-Authored-By: Paul Bourke <paul.bourke@oracle.com>
Change-Id: I73bcd1c97bbaf742af883dbf281a8d76aff8aebf

commit_message:
Add support to inherited project role grant calls

Once inherited project role grant calls are
implemented on python-keystoneclient,
python-openstackclient also should support such
calls.
This patch add such support as well as its
related tests.

Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: Id72670be8640e5c6e2490a6ef849e9ec3493b1a9
Implements: blueprint hierarchical-multitenancy

This commit removes attempts to close a success message, because horizon code
may hide and remove the message before tests are able to close it. This
could trigger false negatives from time to time.

commit_message:
Remove attempts to close success message in tests

This commit removes attempts to close a success message, because horizon code
may hide and remove the message before tests are able to close it. This
could trigger false negatives from time to time.
It's harmless to ignore success the message as long as it is present on the page.

Change-Id: I660d174493cade75fcab6a8f5b7f6214dd188589
Related-Bug: #1466332

commit_message:
Remove openstack.common modules

This patch removes unused openstack.common modules and replaces
versionutils with oslo_log.versionutils.
This fixes the gate issue partly, by removing openstack.common.log which
in some cases could override CONF object in horizon.

Change-Id: I94972726129c256d53377320b8b632afb56b8906
Closes-Bug: #1466332

commit_message:
Use monotonic lib. to avoid finding monotonic time function

That library already does this same/equivalent search and
ensures that a monotonically increasing time is made available
so we can just avoid looking around for it ourselves.

Change-Id: I2b5c69430d75a095f6743c10e2d9281f7d9120e0

commit_message:
Port Event based Subnet binding and ARP responder install

Change the Subnet binding and ARP responder to be dynamically (only
where needed) installed as response to port status form the switch ,
Until this patch we looped on all the subnets and routers on all port
status ignoring the actual port configured on the switch

Change-Id: I59d03ffc52a9b47eeebe4f467a1d41fe1844c8ae

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-19 14:44:41.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ironic_lib/test_utils.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I797d23fc5283e1951f8f75eecc23830b1ae0de69
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I797d23fc5283e1951f8f75eecc23830b1ae0de69

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-04-16 11:13:52.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/phy-net-bridge-mapping.rst'], 'message': 'Implement external physical bridge mapping in linuxbridge

In some deployment scenario, it is not allowed to remove system
ethernet configuration from physical interface to newly-created
physical bridge by neutron due to some IT regulations.

End-users require to take advantage of the pre-existed(user-defined)
physical bridge to connect tap devices.

Change-Id: Ic76907a852f8e85d47fdc4286cf86ac57076ce34
'}]
commit_message:
Implement external physical bridge mapping in linuxbridge

In some deployment scenario, it is not allowed to remove system
ethernet configuration from physical interface to newly-created
physical bridge by neutron due to some IT regulations.

End-users require to take advantage of the pre-existed(user-defined)
physical bridge to connect tap devices.

Change-Id: Ic76907a852f8e85d47fdc4286cf86ac57076ce34

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: Example of using VIF plug script

This patch is a sample usage of the proposed VIF_PLUGIN_SCRIPT
mechanism. This field will be populated by a Neutron mechanism driver
and refers to driver specific script that will be called from the
virtualization driver when the system is ready to connect the guest to a
L2 network.

Change-Id: I3b5daadc9bba446cd6c644f1052b05cb77111b19

commit_message:
Make l3 agent prefix delegation pluggable

Unlocks the prefix delegation feature so that developers may create
drivers for other prefix delegation services in the future.
Operators can select the driver via the new configuration option
"pd_dhcp_driver".

DocImpact
Change-Id: I2a9342c14825458f814d1ec9fa5a992b7f6e13f7
Implements: blueprint ipv6-prefix-delegation

commit_message:
Add an internal DHCPv6 agent for Prefix Delegation

In order to use prefix delegation without the use of an external service
such as Dibbler this patch adds a small agent dedicated to handling
DHCPv6 Prefix Delegation which can run alongside the L3 Agent.

The agent can be started using the "neutron-pd-agent" command and
must run with elevated privileges. The L3 Agent communicates with this
service via a driver which can be enabled in the neutron settings file
by setting pd_dhcp_driver to neutron_pd_agent.

In order to configure the neutron PD agent the "pd_socket_loc" and
"pd_interface" configuration options have been added.

Co-Authored-By: Bradley Jones <jones.bradley@me.com>

DocImpact
Change-Id: Ic3849b4f0ad64804b642d00daadb9f265f2a7b62
Implements: blueprint neutron-ipv6-prefix-delegation-service

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-05-13 00:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/api/rpc/handlers/dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_mech_driver.py', 'neutron/common/utils.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/api/rpc/handlers/test_dhcp_rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_rpc.py', 'neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py'], 'message': "Return early from RPC call handlers with no return value

Oslo messaging reminder:
cast: Send and forget. You only get an ACK from the messaging server,
not from the intended recipient.
call: Block until the recipient sends a return value or exception.

Agents often use call and not cast when updating about certain events,
even though the recipient (Neutron server in this case) has no return
value on the RPC endpoint (Think OVS agent update_device_up). The intention
is to notify that something happened, so naturally you don't care about
a return value. In the cases I observed there is no error handling in
the agents either.

Since there's no need to wait for a response or to see if the server
successfully updates whatever it is that it needs to update, we have
two choices:
a) Switch from call to cast in these cases
b) It can still be preferable to use call and not cast to get a
   stronger delivery guarantee. Perhaps you'd still want to bug out
   if the recipient is down or otherwise non-responsive.

Note: The oslo.notify API uses cast underneath so that's not a real
      alternative.

In this patch I propose B, because honestly it's easier for my puny
mind to imagine a world where when one side sends a message the other
side actually receives it, and not operate under an assumption where
notifications are non-reliable. Keeping that in mind, I prefer call to cast.
If this is way off base please do call me out!

To remedy the performance hit, I changed the RPC endpoints on the server
to process the message with eventlet.spawn_n, following a conversation
with sileht from Oslo messaging (This pattern is common in Nova).

Surprisingly, from my very simple tests with ml2.report_device_up,
this did not make a big difference from the agent's point of view.
It seems like most of the time in a call is spent in
Oslo messaging overhead or rabbit, but not processing the response on
the server. Still, this change could make an impact on other RPC messages
or when the neutron server is busy. It will also let us leverage ongoing
performance work in Oslo messaging such as:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1437951

Change-Id: I012dfb709622b2a48705d6a999856c7ae93a7ca2
"}]
commit_message:
Return early from RPC call handlers with no return value

Oslo messaging reminder:
cast: Send and forget. You only get an ACK from the messaging server,
not from the intended recipient.
call: Block until the recipient sends a return value or exception.

Agents often use call and not cast when updating about certain events,
even though the recipient (Neutron server in this case) has no return
value on the RPC endpoint (Think OVS agent update_device_up). The intention
is to notify that something happened, so naturally you don't care about
a return value. In the cases I observed there is no error handling in
the agents either.

Since there's no need to wait for a response or to see if the server
successfully updates whatever it is that it needs to update, we have
two choices:
a) Switch from call to cast in these cases
b) It can still be preferable to use call and not cast to get a
   stronger delivery guarantee. Perhaps you'd still want to bug out
   if the recipient is down or otherwise non-responsive.

Note: The oslo.notify API uses cast underneath so that's not a real
      alternative.

In this patch I propose B, because honestly it's easier for my puny
mind to imagine a world where when one side sends a message the other
side actually receives it, and not operate under an assumption where
notifications are non-reliable. Keeping that in mind, I prefer call to cast.
If this is way off base please do call me out!

To remedy the performance hit, I changed the RPC endpoints on the server
to process the message with eventlet.spawn_n, following a conversation
with sileht from Oslo messaging (This pattern is common in Nova).

Surprisingly, from my very simple tests with ml2.report_device_up,
this did not make a big difference from the agent's point of view.
It seems like most of the time in a call is spent in
Oslo messaging overhead or rabbit, but not processing the response on
the server. Still, this change could make an impact on other RPC messages
or when the neutron server is busy. It will also let us leverage ongoing
performance work in Oslo messaging such as:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.messaging/+bug/1437951

Change-Id: I012dfb709622b2a48705d6a999856c7ae93a7ca2

commit_message:
Add availability_zone support

By adding the availability_zone attribute to agents, networks and
routers, users will be able to specify where network services run.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Co-Authored-By: IWAMOTO Toshihiro <iwamoto@valinux.co.jp>

Change-Id: Ib8ed2e7fd1a518f9199a9d3852d62a9ec604e276
Implements: blueprint add-availability-zone

option to use the legacy MidoNet API to go to ZOOM.

commit_message:
API: Get a subset of fields from Ports and Chassis

Since this feature is enabled for nodes we should make other resources
to consistently support this feature, so this patch allows users
to specify a list of fields that will be returned when GET'ing a port
or chassis (or a collection of those)

A small refactor was done as part of the test_port.py and test_chassis.py
to make the import names consistent across the tests modules for nodes,
ports and chassis resources.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1466495
Change-Id: Id27d1322c7abf0900bfdab47a1dab59687d9b02b

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-15 19:50:56.000000000', 'files': ['swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py'], 'message': 'move replication code to ReplicatedObjectController

Moving _connect_put_node, send_file, _transfer_data and _store_object
methods to ReplicatedObjectController. Each one of these methods are
specific to replication policy.  EC policy implements their own
version of them.

Of these four methods, only _store_object and _connect_put_node are
required to be implemented by the policy specific Object Controllers.

Change-Id: Ifc72461b77dbfdaae9d63417f1286e8b5da3ca4e
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
move replication code to ReplicatedObjectController

Moving _connect_put_node, send_file, _transfer_data and _store_object
methods to ReplicatedObjectController. Each one of these methods are
specific to replication policy.  EC policy implements their own
version of them.

Of these four methods, only _store_object and _connect_put_node are
required to be implemented by the policy specific Object Controllers.

Change-Id: Ifc72461b77dbfdaae9d63417f1286e8b5da3ca4e
Signed-off-by: Thiago da Silva <thiago@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the meter unit types to be consistent

The unit types for certain meters generated from
pollsters are not consistent with the once generated
via notifications. This fix handles the mismatch.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1460696

Change-Id: Ibd82fa4a5a4e66abaf2a6d0bbe18df4fbfac3ffb
(cherry picked from commit 7dfb37ea4014669f84451e6ddca3fb61872716d7)

commit_message:
Nova requires concurrency 2.1.0 or better

Nova needs the new release of oslo.concurrency in order to be able
to cleanup security bug 1387543.

Change-Id: I08693891b2b4c1d4c166e41b38adc6776e25d8e5
Related-Bug: #1387543

commit_message:
Add handler of sample creation notification

This change add a notification handler of sample.create event, which is
emitted when posting samples via /v2/meters API. The sample's info is
include in the payload of notification.

Partially implements: blueprint api-no-pipeline

Change-Id: I3941b851249c0f70f864bae32da154819b3e5dd7

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-18 16:47:15.000000000', 'files': ['guidelines/http.rst'], 'message': 'Add guidance on 500 Internal Server Error

500 Internal Server Error should only be returned to a user in the case
of an unrecoverable server-side failure. It should never be returned to
the user due to a user-initiated error condition.

Change-Id: I2255ca228ac260b9b74a97df2db27b1050e54509
'}]
commit_message:
Add guidance on 500 Internal Server Error

500 Internal Server Error should only be returned to a user in the case
of an unrecoverable server-side failure. It should never be returned to
the user due to a user-initiated error condition.

Change-Id: I2255ca228ac260b9b74a97df2db27b1050e54509

commit_message:
RabbitMQ container with HA support

This is new RabbitMQ container with support for HA. It's next step for
provide HA support in Kolla project. RabbitMQ is supporting now
active/active model and It's ready for active/passive model.

Change-Id: I2eb6c65f6268ee96d377e72cf880a01c8042559e
Implements: blueprint rabbitmq-ha

subject: Add Neutron/Nova Floating IP create (i.e. allocate to project)
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-06-24 13:10:06.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_neutron.py', 'shade/__init__.py', 'shade/_tasks.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_nova.py'], 'message': 'Add Neutron/Nova Floating IP create (i.e. allocate to project)

Some clouds out there are still running nova-network but we want to
provide support for neutron specific features and concepts like ports,
networks, subnets, etc.

This change is part of a set that adds neutron support to existing
floating IP-related functions, hiding that behind resource-oriented
methods.
For instance, at high level, end-users can now request that a public IP
is assigned to an instance without worrying about the specific service,
procedures and protocols used to provide that feature in the target
cloud.

Change-Id: I2196ebf9b0131346675f90ca9fb21c3baf8d177f
'}]
commit_message:
Add Neutron/Nova Floating IP create (i.e. allocate to project)

Some clouds out there are still running nova-network but we want to
provide support for neutron specific features and concepts like ports,
networks, subnets, etc.

This change is part of a set that adds neutron support to existing
floating IP-related functions, hiding that behind resource-oriented
methods.
For instance, at high level, end-users can now request that a public IP
is assigned to an instance without worrying about the specific service,
procedures and protocols used to provide that feature in the target
cloud.

Change-Id: I2196ebf9b0131346675f90ca9fb21c3baf8d177f

commit_message:
Merge security groups tests between v2 and v2.1

Currently v2 and v2.1 have separate functional tests and their
corresponding sample files. As v2 and v2.1 are supposed to be identical,
there is overhead to maintain two set of functional tests and sample files.
We can have one set of tests which can run for both v2 and v2.1.

This commit merges security groups functional tests.

In V2.1 os-access-ip is separate plugin where in v2 it was mixed in server
plugin itself. So os-access-ip extension is enabled to run
merged functional tests for both v2 and v2.1.

Change-Id: I45bc8a6ab4b48bff6ed28b4c779b575252161ed1

commit_message:
Add pool_id param for pool_member related proxy methods

pool_id is needed for generating url of Neutron LBaaS pool_member
resource. This patch added this parameter to all pool_member
related methods in proxy layer.

Change-Id: I95b094b25f1367770de035c93c4fe88428eef8dc

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-23 20:58:18.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': "Add Solum to OpenStack Projects List

Solum has achived a level of stability and maturity where all of its
contributors feel it is ready to join OpenStack. Solum's mission is to
make cloud services easier to consume and integrate with your application
development process. Adoption of Solum will lead to more application
developers using OpenStack as a cloud platform.

It is directly built on OpenStack infrastructure services including Heat,
Keystone, Glance, and Swift. Through Heat it also uses Nova, and soon
will also use Magnum.

Solum conforms to each of our four opens:
  Open Source
  -----------
  Apache v2.0 License, no dependencies restrict deployment or redistribution.

  Open Development
  ----------------
  We use Stackforge, including Gerrit for all code reviews with a test driven
  gate. The PTL is available as a liason for cross-project teams. We integrate
  with other projects in OpenStack to prevent overlap in our efforts. Solum
  conforms completely to the OpenStack development style.

  Open Design
  -----------
  Our project direction is discussed openly in pubic forums including at
  multiple design summits and midcycle meetups. We use the openstack-dev
  mailing list to discuss issues.

  Open Community
  --------------
  Solum's PTL is chosen by the community in open elections. We hold weekly IRC
  meetings in official OpenStack meeting channels.

We are OpenStack API interoperable, using keystone middleware for discovery
and authentication. We have an active team of dedicated contributors who are
committed to the success of the project.

Change-Id: Id74222381910f006a5a69f9e3746101bd4a32e12
"}]
commit_message:
Add Solum to OpenStack Projects List

Solum has achived a level of stability and maturity where all of its
contributors feel it is ready to join OpenStack. Solum's mission is to
make cloud services easier to consume and integrate with your application
development process. Adoption of Solum will lead to more application
developers using OpenStack as a cloud platform.

It is directly built on OpenStack infrastructure services including Heat,
Keystone, Glance, and Swift. Through Heat it also uses Nova, and soon
will also use Magnum.

Solum conforms to each of our four opens:
  Open Source
  -----------
  Apache v2.0 License, no dependencies restrict deployment or redistribution.

  Open Development
  ----------------
  We use Stackforge, including Gerrit for all code reviews with a test driven
  gate. The PTL is available as a liason for cross-project teams. We integrate
  with other projects in OpenStack to prevent overlap in our efforts. Solum
  conforms completely to the OpenStack development style.

  Open Design
  -----------
  Our project direction is discussed openly in pubic forums including at
  multiple design summits and midcycle meetups. We use the openstack-dev
  mailing list to discuss issues.

  Open Community
  --------------
  Solum's PTL is chosen by the community in open elections. We hold weekly IRC
  meetings in official OpenStack meeting channels.

We are OpenStack API interoperable, using keystone middleware for discovery
and authentication. We have an active team of dedicated contributors who are
committed to the success of the project.

Change-Id: Id74222381910f006a5a69f9e3746101bd4a32e12

subject: Pin the oslo.i18n version for kilo
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-24 10:16:40.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': "Pin the oslo.i18n version for kilo

keystoneclient that is compatible with kilo depends on oslo.i18n but
it is incompatible with oslo.i18n version 2.0.0 because 'oslo.i18n'
namespace has been removed.

Update the requirements.txt temporarily to pin the version of oslo.i18n
to match what's set in Kilo's OpenStack global requirements until how
to handle library requirements is decided by the community

Change-Id: I3c9e4b863579b768f63d98677843f1570103c9dc
Fixes: MNP-160
"}]
commit_message:
Pin the oslo.i18n version for kilo

keystoneclient that is compatible with kilo depends on oslo.i18n but
it is incompatible with oslo.i18n version 2.0.0 because 'oslo.i18n'
namespace has been removed.

Update the requirements.txt temporarily to pin the version of oslo.i18n
to match what's set in Kilo's OpenStack global requirements until how
to handle library requirements is decided by the community

Change-Id: I3c9e4b863579b768f63d98677843f1570103c9dc
Fixes: MNP-160

subject: Set cidr required true for create network
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-24 08:56:15.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/networks/workflows.py'], 'message': 'Set cidr required true for create network

create a network with subnet, if no cidr is specified, the workflow
will not be able to process to next without any message to inform the
user that the cidr is required. This patch adds required attribute to
cidr field.

Change-Id: Ie29e4f6b7e6fe309c67c273f814a2c43ba36afac
'}]
commit_message:
Set cidr required true for create network

create a network with subnet, if no cidr is specified, the workflow
will not be able to process to next without any message to inform the
user that the cidr is required. This patch adds required attribute to
cidr field.

Change-Id: Ie29e4f6b7e6fe309c67c273f814a2c43ba36afac

subject: Only use tput when we are writing to a terminal
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-23 13:41:32.000000000', 'files': ['functions'], 'message': "Only use tput when we are writing to a terminal

The output of some of the commands, especially building the list of
unrelease changes, needs to be easy to pass to pastebinit. When we're
writing to a pipe, don't use tput to send special control sequences.

Change-Id: I4c8a4ffd08f362c16bbfd5ca9a47996b4f31f321
"}]
commit_message:
Only use tput when we are writing to a terminal

The output of some of the commands, especially building the list of
unrelease changes, needs to be easy to pass to pastebinit. When we're
writing to a pipe, don't use tput to send special control sequences.

Change-Id: I4c8a4ffd08f362c16bbfd5ca9a47996b4f31f321

commit_message:
Produce more meaningful exception messages in nested stacks

This produces a nested exception like:
 'ValueError: resources.nested.resources.my_server: it is broken, sorry'

This re-uses the path mechanism that StackValidationFailed exception
uses.

Change-Id: Id5204c15ee96784e04522ab3c5a8e66900f9a1d3
Closes-bug: 1459837

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8106, 'name': 'Haomeng,Wang', 'email': 'wanghaomeng@gmail.com', 'username': 'whaom'}, {'_account_id': 9382, 'name': 'Shilla Saebi', 'email': 'shilla.saebi@gmail.com', 'username': 'shillasaebi'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'Flying to the moon with a Jetpack!'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-06-24 11:59:20.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/ironic-install/defaults/required_defaults_Debian.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/defaults/required_packages_Debian.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/templates/systemd_template.j2', 'README.rst', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/templates/nginx.conf.j2', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/defaults/required_defaults_RedHat.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/defaults/required_packages_RedHat.yml', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/defaults/required_defaults_RedHat.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/tasks/main.yml', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/templates/upstart_template.j2', 'playbooks/roles/bifrost-create-vm-nodes/defaults/required_defaults_CentOS.yml', 'scripts/env-setup.sh'], 'message': "Refactor ironic-install playbook to support CentOS & RHEL

Refactor the ironic-install role so that it can be used on
Centos and RHEL. Also add a new template for systemd configuration
so we can install and run the ironic services.

Document the additional steps that RHEL and CentOS users will
need to take to get bifrost up and running.

Install gcc in env-setup.sh as it is needed to install pip and
we can't take it for granted.

Temporarily remove amttool from RedHat family dependencies since
it's not currently packaged for RHEL or CentOS 7. We'll handle this
in a separate patch.

Change libxslt-dev to libxslt1-dev as it is the correct name for the
package.

Closes-Bug: 1460930
Closes-Bug: 1456896
Partial-Bug: 1463871

Change-Id: I72a5b329d3c55350644a777b5a77d61947c921bc
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor ironic-install playbook to support CentOS & RHEL

Refactor the ironic-install role so that it can be used on
Centos and RHEL. Also add a new template for systemd configuration
so we can install and run the ironic services.

Document the additional steps that RHEL and CentOS users will
need to take to get bifrost up and running.

Install gcc in env-setup.sh as it is needed to install pip and
we can't take it for granted.

Temporarily remove amttool from RedHat family dependencies since
it's not currently packaged for RHEL or CentOS 7. We'll handle this
in a separate patch.

Change libxslt-dev to libxslt1-dev as it is the correct name for the
package.

Closes-Bug: 1460930
Closes-Bug: 1456896
Partial-Bug: 1463871

Change-Id: I72a5b329d3c55350644a777b5a77d61947c921bc

commit_message:
Return timer after adding it to internal list

In some cases, its useful to selectively stop
some timers and not all. This fix allows a way
for client applications to maintain a handle
on timers and be able to stop some of them
selectively.

This is needed by
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/190842/

Change-Id: Ib258c07d6dd12ef7cc9f4a6c8cbde885048ceef8
